(Updated) The main events of the 16th day of the war.

Ukrainians are bravely resisting the Russian invasion for the 16th day. The main battles are taking place in the direction of Kyiv, Chernihiv, Kharkiv, Mykolayiv and Mariupol. The latter has been blockaded by Russian troops for 10 days. A real humanitarian disaster has begun in Mariupol.

The Charter97.org website covers online the events of the 16th day of the war. You can see what was happening in Ukraine on March 10 in our previous online broadcast

Special broadcast on Ukraine 24

prinCZess said: 2) Do Ukrainians even have T-80s? Is their camo/paint pattern the same as Russia's? Click to expand...

There is very little actual footage from Russian forces, while Novorussia forces have embedded journalists, so most of the footage is indeed from them and their gear can be summed up ''anything they can get''.Ukraine had several hundred T-80 mothballed and some in active service, but until 2014 they mostly used T-64, to keep the costs down. After 2014 they started taking them out of the mothballs and issuing them to tank companies of motorized and airmobile brigades (battalions of mechanized and armored brigades are still using variants of T-64). The problem is that due to dispersed nature of military manufacturing in Soviet Union, while one of the T-80 assembly plants was in Kharkov, many of the components were made outside modern day Ukraine, so only limited number of tanks could be returned to operational status, while others can be towed out and used as bait for Russian airstrikes/material for propaganda videos.Both sides use similar paint for their vehicles, that's why Russians are using those big white Zs and Vs, while Ukrainians used big white II in 2014/15.

Hiszpański resort obrony podał, że samolotem wojskowym przewieziono także rodziców dzieci oraz 22 innych uchodźców z Ukrainy, w tym dzieci.
